**Setup:** Velocity clone; dual twisted 24awg Ni/28awg kanthal @ .27Î©; cotton wicks; 45 W

**Testing:** Inawera Gold for Pipe @ 3%; Aged: 27 days

**Flavor description:**  Rich, smooth, blend of light pipe tobaccos with heavy notes of lightly spiced honey.  Before a steep, I swore I tasted real metallic gold.

**Off-flavors:** Nothing really off unless you count the metallic gold you get before a short steep.  However it is "gold" for pipe, right?

**Throat hit:** 3/10 pretty smooth with a heavy feel

**Uses:** Good as is, but would work in a blended tobacco base too.  

**Pairings:**   other preferred tobaccos.  Could be complimented by small amounts of nuts, caramel, vanilla, possibly some of the more buttery custards, or even some light floral flavorings.

**Notes:**   I don't like the idea of trying to doctor this flavor too much, simply because of its delicate complexity.  I think this flavor works fine as a shake n vape, however it does change a bit over time leaving little to be desired as far as flavor either way IMO.

**Bonus Recipe**

Ingredient | Percentage
---|---
INW Gold for Pipe | 3-4%
